data.title: Douglas Adams Book & Series List
data.meta_description: A complete list of all Douglas Adams's books & series in order (17 books) (2 series). Browse plot descriptions, book covers, genres, pseudonyms, ratings and awards.
data.text:
The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy

Jan-1979

/ Science Fiction

Seconds before Earth demolished to make way for a galactic freeway, Arthur Dent is plucked off the planet by his friend Ford Prefect, a researcher for the revised edition of 'The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy' who, for the first fifteen years, has...

Restaurant at the End of the Universe

1980

/ Science Fiction

Facing annihilation at the hands of the warlike Vogons? Time for cup of tea! Join the cosmically displaced Arthur Dent and his uncommon comrades in arms in their desperate search for a place to eat, as they hurtle across space powered by pure improba...

Life, the Universe and Everything

Jan-1983

/ Science Fiction

The unhappy inhabitants of planet Krikkit are sick of looking at the night sky above their heads--so they plan to destroy it. The universe, that is. Now only five individuals stand between the white killer robots of Krikkit and their goals of total a...

The Meaning of Liff

Mar-1984

/ General Fiction

In life and, indeed, in liff, there are many hundreds of common experiences, feelings, situations and even objects which we all know and recognize, but for which no words exist. This text uses place names to describe some of these meanings.

...

So Long, and Thanks for All the Fish

Mar-1985

/ Science Fiction

ARTHUR DENT IS OUT OF HIS BATHROBE, IN LOVE, AND WONDERING WHY THE DOLPHINS SAID...SO LONG, AND THANKS FOR ALL THE FISH Was the earth really demolished? Why did all the dolphins disappear? What is God's final message to His creatures? Arthur Dent,...

Young Zaphoid Plays It Safe

1986

/ Science Fiction

Contains the unabridged texts of "The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy," "The Restaurant at the End of the Universe," "Life, the Universe, and Everything," "So Long, and Thanks for All the Fish," and "Young Zaphod Plays It Safe"...

Dirk Gently's Holistic Detective Agency

May-1987

/ Science Fiction

There is a long tradition of Great Detectives, and Dirk Gently does not belong to it. But his search for a missing cat uncovers a ghost, a time-traveller, AND... the devastating secret of humankind! DETECTIVE GENTLY'S BILL FOR SAVING HUMAN RACE FR...

The Long Dark Tea-Time of the Soul

Mar-1989

/ Science Fiction

Beloved, bumbling Detective Dirk Gently returns in this standalone novel from Douglas Adams, the legendary author of one of the most beloved science fiction novels of all time, The Hitchhiker’s Guide to the Galaxy.When a check-in desk at London’s...

Mostly Harmless

Oct-1992

/ Science Fiction

Now celebrating the 42nd anniversary of The Hitchhiker’s Guide to the Galaxy, soon to be a Hulu original series! “Hitchhiker fans rejoice! . . . [Here’s] more of the same zany nonsensical mayhem.” -- The New York Times Book ReviewIt...

The Salmon of Doubt: Hitchhiking the Galaxy One Last Time

May-2002

/ Science Fiction

Douglas Adams changed the face of science fiction with his cosmically comic novel The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy and its classic sequels. Sadly for his countless admirers, he hitched his own ride to the great beyond much too soon. Culled posthu...

The Deeper Meaning of Liff

Apr-2005

/ Science Fiction

A rollicking, thought-provoking dictionary for the modern age, featuring definitions for those things we don't have words for, from the New York Times bestselling author behind The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy, Douglas Adams, and TV producer John...

Shada

Feb-2013

/ Science Fiction

The legendary lost Doctor Who story from the unique mind of Douglas Adams Inside this book is another book the strangest, most important and most dangerous book in the entire universe. The Worshipful and Ancient Law of Gallifrey is one of the ...

City of Death

May-2015

/ Science Fiction

The Doctor takes Romana for a holiday in Paris �" a city which, like a fine wine, has a bouquet all its own. Especially if you visit during one of the vintage years. But the TARDIS takes them to 1979, a table-wine year, a year whose vintage is soure...

The Pirate Planet

Jan-2017

/ Steampunk

The hugely powerful Key to Time has been split into six segments, all of which have been disguised and hidden throughout time and space. Now the even more powerful White Guardian wants the Doctor to find the pieces. With the first segment successfull...

Doctor Who and the Krikkitmen

Jan-2018

/ Science Fiction

Rediscover the lost Doctor Who adventure by Douglas Adams. Intergalactic war? That’s just not cricket … or is it? The Doctor promised Romana the end of the universe, so she’s less than impressed when what she gets is a cricket match. But then...

Doctor Who and The Pirate Planet

Mar-2021

/ Science Fiction
